Great Product	Our last experience with a DVR was DirecTV several years ago.  It was very slow and clunky.  We dropped DirecTV 4 years ago and became cord cutters.  The Bolt is amazing.  The menu system is awesome, it's very fast, and I keep finding things it does that I don't expect.  QuickMode is perfect for slow moving programs like documentaries.  Great well thought out product.  But...needs more apps.  MLB  would be really nice.  I'll still have to use my old Roku for that.

Good and solid but needs a smarter user	It is a good piece of equipment and is relatively easy to set up.  Has a few quirks that I am still working out. Was rather surprised that there was no start up guide in the box when I purchased it brand new.So for an unplugged tv tech newbie this was a little challenging. That being said the TiVo support seems good so far.  But don't call them at 6:46 pm pacific time because they turn on their auto-recorded message of "TiVo is now closed-- our regular business hours are from blah, blah, blah until 7:00 pm pacific standard time. Please call back during those hours".  So in fact, their hours are until 6:45 PM!Still evaluating and will update if anything changes!

Upgraded one of my old TiVo's and am thrilled I did!	So far I'm loving it.  Skip mode is awesome.  Amazon Prime comes on faster.  I was hoping to see some baseball in the quick mode but they didn't have it available.  I am looking forward to trying that option but haven't seen anything I watch yet that has that feature.  Otherwise I would have given it a 5 star.

GREAT NEW FEATURES	I really like this new TiVo BOLT. I have not used all the new features yet,  but am very pleased that it is 4K UHD compatible and the SkipMode is awesome. I wasn't expecting it to work anywhere near  as well as it does. You just have to be careful to push the skip button only once. If it is pushed twice it will skip the commercial, the next segment of the program and the next commercial.So far I have only one complaint. It is ugly. Most A/V components are black and have a sleek look that will blend in with your other components. This unit is bright white,  stands out like a sore thumb and looks as if it was designed and made by a toy maker. I am working very hard to figure out a way to disguise it.

Best TIVO yet	Love it overall!Likes:- 4 tuners is great- Netflix app works- Small size of unit- Menus responsive and easy to navigate (except one issue, see below)- SKIP is wonderful!- PLEX app is nice to have built in- Works great with TIVO mini- Add program to record via the web when you are away from homeNits:- I don't like going too far up in the menus landing you in the top suggested item tiles.  It is very jarring and I almost never meant to go there.- PLEX app crashes (but doesn't crash the whole box)- Boot time is still VERY long- I miss the antenna and cable inputs (though I may be the only one)- No Watch Live TV menu item (have to use button on remote)- Price is a bit high- The mixing of recorded and streaming content in My Shows needs more design work.  I have to turn it off for all of my OnePass titles.  It is rare that you want to see all past seasons when you are just recording new episodes and watching them.

I love several things about my new Bolt	I love several things about my new Bolt. It is super fast, much faster connecting to my Amazon and Netflix accounts. I love that I can record 4 shows at once. The SkipMode is pretty cool. I like that I can schedule recordings through the app. Probably my biggest negative is the remote doesn't work to control my TV sound/input etc. After extensive and exhausting searching through all the codes in the Bolt we came to the conclusion that they are just not compatible. I am using my old remote from my Premier XL as I refuse to spend another $50 for a learning remote. Am kinda disappointed that one didn't come standard with the "newest, best thing" from TiVo.

great ugrade for TiVo premier uses	Former owner of Tivo Premier with two tuners, so i'll skip the part where i might rave about how much better TiVo is than the cable box and focus on the differences between the two TiVos.  Four tuners is v useful during that highly contested sunday 9p time slot.  Bolt loads apps much faster and skip mode button works wonders when available.  The ability to view shows on a tablet is sweet but i'd really like to be able to get it on a laptop w/ out having to resort to kttmg.  Can't test out the 4k yet, but hopefully soon.  Very happy with the upgrade.  A lower price on a lifetime subscription once the 'free' year runs out would also be nice...  in any case, highly recommended!

TIVO could rule the world of Streaming and OTA TV, if it only gets a fews things fixed.	This is a very good competitor to Roku, but does it bet it???  Yes and NoYes, it combines LiveTV with streaming pretty good. But also NO since it can't even search on the LIMITED streaming apps it has correctly.  Often times I must go to the app and bypass the TIVO search.Also NO since TIVO has such a limited list of steaming applications.  I can't even watch the election results on FOX News tonight.Also why would you give me HBOgo when most of your new customers are CableCutters.  Give me HBOnow, Starz, FoxNews, AMC, etc.

The BOLT vs technologically challenged senior	So far I think it is wonderful - the only thing that is not working is the "skip" feature, although it did work to begin with and that has been disappointing..  I found it somewhat difficult to program the "on-off" and "volume/mute" buttons. but after a friend ddi that for me it has been perfect. I also needed to have help to keep the recording feature from wanting to record every season of a show, but I think I can handle that now.  I guess what I am saying is that this isn't the easiest procedure for a senior who is technologically challenged, but I guess that is what friends are for!

I love the TiVO Bolt and what it does.	I love the TiVO Bolt and what it does to integrate the many ways I watch movies and shows. It does what it says it will very well. Four stars instead of 5 because there are some things I wish it did. Like recording to the disk from Netflix or HULU. I wish I could record while I sleep when my bandwidth isn't being used and then watch some other time. The TiVO suggestions is way too random and I wish I could mass delete shows or folders instead of deleting one at a time. Even with those concerns the TiVO Bolt is a huge upgrade from my standard cable box. I Love it.

Love this BOLT!	Now with a month or so with the BOLT, I have to say I am very pleased with this upgrade from my Roamio OTA. When operational, I must say I was somewhat disappointed to see that HULU was missing due to an incompatibility with HULU and the BOLT at that time; and that the on screen menu color scheme was a dreadful black and white, with a smattering of blue.  Over the past few days, the system was updated and revealed HULU!  Well done! I'm also really thrilled with the new SKIP feature that instantly skips through all  commercials with the push of a single button (on those shows where this feature is available, which is most). It was also nice to see that my keyboard remote also works seamlessly.Once the horrible color scheme is resolved and allows me the option to enable the traditional TiVo color scheme, this review then becomes 5-STAR

80% there... but good enough for now.	I love the affordable 4 tuner, the SkipMode feature, and the fact that this box is 4K! Unfortunately, I bought the 500GB model which I will want to expand eventually, however, after I purchased I noticed that while an option did exist, it's basically impossible to find now. Also, the ability to stream my shows outside of the home is a miss, as downloading to my device is cumbersome as the app has to be up during the duration of the download. Once they fix the lack of a supported eSATA drive and non-wifi streaming, I will be insanely happy with the BOLT.

I like the commercial extinction is my favorite	I like the commercial extinction is my favorite. I wish it would only record the shows I want would be great, I can't believe all the stuff it records but I will get used to it eventually. There are lots of movies available etc... and it will take some time pick up other stuff that is available. I wish they had made a video like my last Tivo I had that is not supported anymore what a shame it was so easy to use and the way you could record the programs, so I got stuff that is better now and other stuff that I miss I had before. Overall I'm glad I bought the new BOLT.

Tivo continues evolution	Overall still like Tivo. This is our third.Network services are slow to launch when activated from search on Bolt. Services such as Hulu and Netflix launch much faster on Roku.Like the Android app. Would be nice if it had bigger buttons for use on exercise equipment and thumbs up/down for managing recordings. Download is nice advantage.Would like to stream to Roku.RF remote is an improvement to the traditionally nice Tivo remote. Some awkward sequences.Boot still slow after all these years.

Love my new TIVO BOLT: get one!	I love my TIVO BOLT, but Im not sure I would have bought one this expensive if I had bought my new 4K smart TV first. The TV does such a great job pulling down the 4K content directly off the Wifi network. That said, TIVO is hands down the best DVR available. We cut the cord with cable and satellite, and put an antenna on the roof. We record the late night talk shows, Saturday Night Live, PBS stuff like Downton Abbey all for free. And if youre into old shows, theres a huge amount of free content on the side channels available from each of the broadcast. I also like TIVOs suggestions. It often records things I forget to program and offers good stuff I never heard of. I highly recommend TIVO to anyone. (Oh, and the commercial skip thing is AMAZING!)

Great 4k upgrade, pairs nicely with a Tivo Mini	Small size, MoCA,interface to Mini, same great Guide and Remote, and 4k readiness (once there is 4k content to record), make it a natural upgrade and allows us to move our Premiere with Lifetime Service to our seasonal  Summer cottage. Don't like the annual fee after year one, and hope there's a compelling deal on Product Lifetime Service for much less than the current list price.

Good product but did not meet my needs or expectations.	The newest TiVo Bolt is less intuitive than Tivos I have had in the past. Clicking thru commercials is great, however.  Over all,  since I could not get all the OTA channels I needed and the Internet integration was not as seamless as I was led to expect, I ended up returning the product.

Bolt is a great box, needs a few tweaks in the interface	Overall very happy with the TiVo Bolt interface.  Recording a season seems like it should be easier to setup from the grid.  A quick link to the Sling, PSview  and DirectTv now streaming services should be added so I dont have to change inputs.

The BOLT is really great. I ditched my Cable DVR after 10 years ...	The BOLT is really great.  I ditched my Cable DVR after 10 years because of 3 things...1.  I was paying $25 / month.  It did have 6 tuners, but it also needed rebooting monthly.2. Unifying all my sources of programming3. Skip feature - it works perfectly and is really nice to have.BONUS:  RF Remote.  No more fussing with positioning the remote to get it pointed just right...my equipment is behind glass.  The Tivo remote works like magic.Unfortunately, Brighthouse uses switched digital video, so I had to get a tuning adapter...which is 50% larger than the BOLT....so there goes the advantage of reducing clutter in my rack.  Nothing you can do about though.  Sure would be nice just to have CableCard.

like what's provided in the "what to watch now" menus)	I'm a cord cutter who hasn't had (or wanted) cable or OTA TV in years. I bought the Bolt because it offers both  a universal queue and cross-platform search for streaming content. The curated lists in "browse TV and movies" and the ability to integrate my own content via Plex is icing on the cake.  And even though I didn't care about broadcast TV, I'm actually using it again some simply because it's there. If "my shows" was presented in a more visually appealing way (e.g., like what's provided in the "what to watch  now" menus), and it had the ability to queue shows from within the various apps themselves (e.g., Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, Vudu), it would be darn near perfect.

New menus are not intuitive an have poor layout with focus on the Marketing	New menus are not intuitive an have poor layout with focus on the Marketing. Why am I now getting blasted with more marketing when I FF or RR? Seriously!!Preferred the "by Time" layout from before. Should be able to choose which layout is preferred. Skip should be automatic and not require a press of the D key. Opt in the default not opt out.

I like being able to record 4 shows at the same ...	I like being able to record 4 shows at the same time, the Skip Mode to skip past the commercials of the program, and the One pass to set up a program to record in the future, so you don't have to do it every week.  However, I also subscribe to Sling TV, but the TV Bolt isn't able to support it.  It would just make it that much better if TV Bolt supported Sling TV app.  Then, I could control everything with just the TV Bolt.  Overall, TV Bolt does a great job though.

Font Size more an issue for a mid 50 yr old	the skip feature is great! the font is a bit too small for me now that the TIVO central screen is 1/3 of the tv screen...especially hard to read the tv channel names (like if Im looking for the Hallmark station but I also can search for that station under find tv/search) Font is better now that son gave me his larger TV while he is away at Univ. wonderful to be able to record more shows now...I had a really old TIVO model! most of the "extra" options will not be used by me, howeverI did have issues with the cable card as well and needed 5 to find one to work...an issue I believe with the lake comcast cable company and I had to yell/complain a lot to get the service I needed to get the issue resolved.

TIVO BOLT Review! Mostly GOOD!	The "SKIP" mode is excellent! I'm having a hard time re-learning where the Guide button is on the Remote. I keep pressing "Zoom" because that is where the Guide button was. After nearly 12 years with a Series 2 and/or Premier TIVO remote, it's hard to teach old dog new tricks.I am not entirely sold on the shape of the BOLT. I had a perfect spot where my old Premier was, but the BOLT won't fit because of the hump. Still looks kinda cool though. I figured out a new location.

4-Stars	Pros: records 4 shows simultaneously (no more show clipping)  : SkipMode quickly skips commercial breaks  : QuickMode lets you fast-forward through a recorded show without losing audio &  dialogue fidelity  : very quiet (no cooling fan?)  : very small footprint, lightweightCons:  runs hot (worried about future failure, but so far, so good)  : slightly slower to come out of standby mode  : slow to power up from power down  : SkipMode limited to a few, select channels (for now?)  ; slight glitches/issues with scheduling OnePass with show too far into the futureStill the best DVR on the market, in my opinion.

Good product!  Could be great.	Overall very pleased.  A couple of improvements that I would like to see:1.  QuickMode speed adjustment.  I would like 110, 120, 130.2.  Internet viewing through the TIVO app.3.  Shorter path to delete recordings that you do not finish, perhaps add a delete option to "info".4. Shorter path to "Standby".5.  "Back" from Tivo screen takes you back to TV, right now you have to go "Guide", "Back".6.  Sometimes you return to a recording and it starts at the beginning again.7.  Recording should be part of the "Last" queue.8.  A,B,C buttons could be made better use off, see above suggestions.

This is a great pvr. The TiVo makes it easy to find ...	This is a great pvr. The TiVo makes it easy to find and watch TVs, movies, and music from any available broadcast or streaming  source.The only downsides are minor: I can't get it to work well with my Logitech universal remote, but that's because the Tivo remote is both radio and IR --- the Logitech remote is IR-only.Also, i wish there were an easy way to prefilter "Tivo Suggestions" by language.  Instead, by default, Tivo makes suggestions based on all your local channels, even if you never watch those in your non-dominant language.But these are minor things. On the while, this is a big "thumbs up."

I am very pleased with my new TiVo Bolt	Overall, I am very pleased with my new TiVo Bolt.  It was easy to set up.  I like the performance and the user interface.  I like the capabilities of the apps like Amazon Video, Netflix, and Plex.  However, I was stunned to discover that the Bolt does not have the MLB.tv app loaded or (apparently) available, despite the fact that it is present on the Roamio boxes.  I hope this is going to change before the season gets underway in the Spring.

Very happy to return to Tivo	Very happy to return to Tivo!  Have used Tivos since the very first model, and the family always preferred the interface over the cable company DVRs.  So far, the Bolt wors just as expected, and is much faster than the older models we had.  Cable card installation was easy this time around, as well.  The only negatives so far are the white color, some trouble getting the mini to connect (oddly the problem was resolved only when I changed the Mini name to a one-word name rather than two as suggested on some of the forums), and the lack of an affordable lifetime subscription option compared to the past.

Needs Out of Home Network Streaming & Download Capability	I really like the Bolt. I have a Roamio in another location. I really miss the ability to stream when I am away from the home network, however. I also don't like that I can't download shows when I am away from the home. These are all things the Roamio does well. I understand the functionality for this will be forthcoming in the Bolt. Can't come soon enough. I've been a loyal TiVo user for 15 years and really like the interface.

A crawler would be nice. The skip ads button doesn't work on all ...	The closed caption needs tweaking so it's not near the middle of the screen. A crawler would be nice. The skip ads button doesn't work on all shows.  One pass should have a default setting of only new episodes. The remote is a little awkward, but so was the cable remote. It's nice to get away from cable DVR's. Well worth the money. Far superior to the cable DVR.

Great way to help cut entertainment expenses!	So far so good!  We've had the TIVO BOLT for a few weeks now and as senior citizens it's been a day to day learning experience.  We are of the "owner's manual" generation, and need hands on instructions to guide us.  Thank goodness we have kids that are available to show us how  to operate our electronics.  Just ordered the TIVO Mini for the downstairs t.v.
My Uverse killer	I really like it! We loved our At&t uverse dvr features and this comes very close. And Its Mine!The thing I Love is the skip feature, poof and I'mpast the commercials!

I certainly enjoy the convergence of TV programming / recording and other ...	I certainly enjoy the convergence of TV programming / recording and other streaming content from Netflix and Amazon.  One thing I do wish were available is a wider set of apps (think roku) and a casting capability from the phone (think chromecast).Early on I did run into some issues with a strange HDMI copy protection error thrown by the handshake between the Tivo and the TV.

Cut the Cord w/TIVO Bolt	I recently cut the cord (got rid of Dish), installed an HD antenna for local channels and am using the Bolt to record off the antenna, as well as access Netflix and Amazon Prime video.  Works great, initial start up has some hiccups, but great picture and features. If it had the Sling TV app then I would be able to get rid of my ROKU, but so far great experience and product.

Never going back to Cable Boxes!	I love my new TiVo Bolt. The skip commercials is really nice. It is way better than my DVR from the cable company. This Bolt teamed up with two TIVO mini boxes has really open up all of my TV and it is saving me over $25 a month. I just hate renting cable boxes. The steaming function works really nice. My only wish is that Cox Video On Demand worked in my area, but hopefully in time it will be added.  I also wished I had more control over what is displayed in the Discovery Bar, but I guess I cannot have everything.

This box rocks!	I was a Tivo user many years ago with DirecTv and I'm glad to be back. The DVR functions are intuitive and I am really impressed how quickly I am able to navigate through the menus. Opening Netflix, Amazon, etc. is quick compared to accessing the content thru my TV or BluRay player. The SkipMode is awesome although I wish more programs were included.  And the Tivo app allows me to watch my programming on my cell phone.  Much better than the old Comcast hardware I was using although the new X1 boxes are pretty good.

TiVo Bolt 500GB Entertainment System	SkipMode works well sometimes.  4K compatibility is a welcome feature.  Unfortunately the streaming compatibility of HBO Go is not available on the Bolt.  Until then I will have to use my Apple TV.

I love the Bolt - has all of the easy interfaces ...	I don't know if this is a review of the Bolt or of Comcast.  I love the Bolt - has all of the easy interfaces that make me pay for Tivo in the first place.  However, it took us 4 cable cards from Comcast before we got one to work, and that only happened because we actually had to set up a service call from Comcast.  They said that they have this problem with Tivos.  However, if I had to bet on who was to blame, I'd choose Comcast as the guilty party.  But watch out for this problem when you try to set it up.

The Bolt!	It's taking some getting used to, as I had an older model for years. It does have many nice new features, but the older model was a little simpler in design and approach, which I prefer.I do like the Amazon Prime selections, but would never have enough time to see everything. The wish list is as far as I've gotten.

So far, so good.	Still pretty new to it, but I do love the multiple tuners and the Skip Mode. Haven't tried Quick Mode yet--seems odd, but I'll wait to pass judgement. Also like the Netflix/Amazon/etc interface.I upgraded from a Series 3, so some of the took some getting used to, but I'm getting the hang of it pretty quickly.

TiVo Bolt is the Best Ever !	It took a some time to set the TiVo Bolt up, Don't call your cable provider first ! Talk with the TiVo technician's first, this will save you a lot of time and frustration.But that being said I really think this TiVo BOLT is the best peace of entertainment equipment I have ever owned!I would have gave it 5 stars if not for the cost!our overall experience has been great!even my wife has no trouble using the TiVo BOLT. 5 stars for her!

TiVo Bolt is a great cable cutters box but could be perfect with a little work	I like the ease of set up.  The remote feature and the integration with streaming services such as Netflix and Amazon Prime.Picture quality on the OTA tuners is excellent.It would get 5 stars if it provided access to one or more of the streaming cable services such as SlingTV or DIRECTV Now.  Then it would be a perfect solution for cable cutters.

Great device, needs more apps	Needs DLNA client, not just plex client. Other apps like HBO GO/Now, showtime, etc. maybe open up an App Store like Apple so people can write apps/games for the TiVo. My Tivo is also a little loud, not sure if that is a defect or what.Otherwise love the device and so glad I bought one.

Upgraded to Tivo Bolt..LOVE IT	Replaced my original TIVO with the Tivo Bolt after I received it as a Christmas gift. I love that I can record more shows while watching another show than I could previously. I have also really liked the skip and the Quick Mode features with the Bolt.  The remote has a fast learning curve that was a nice surprise for a remote novice. My only issue was the initial set up with my cable provider, they weren't very educated on troubleshooting set up issues.

Recommended but could be better.	I bought this for my mom so I'm not the primary user but here's my experience in getting the unit setup.No installation instructions were included and the online user manual was not very informative so I had to contact customer service a few times.  Customer service was very easy to access and helpful.  I was especially surprised that the agents appeared to be US based.TIVO Bolt makes a big deal about the commercial skip button.  It ends up that this function is only available on certain shows - maybe 10% or so of total programming.My mom does like the fact that she can access Netflix and Hulu via Bolt.The remote has the selector buttons near the top when it's more natural that those primary buttons should be positioned in the middle of the remote.  The video control buttons are located in the center.Overall, the product does seem to be a good DVR solution for cord cutters.

Tivo Bolt is great but just shy of letting me cut the cable completely	The new BOLT works as advertised with HD Antenna.  It is an easy transition from my cabled TIVO predecessor except for I wish there were more streaming APPs.  I have a ROKU box with SLING subscription that gets me live ESPN and other channels.  Need more than just moving streaming options otherwise it's a 5 STAR!

Installation Nightmare!!	I like the device. Getting this thing up and running was probably the most frustrating experience with technology that I've ever had. It took me two days and numerous calls to Tivo and my cable service provider. The first customer service with a Tivo rep was not good. The rep wanted to be helpful, but didn't have the knowledge base to get it done. It was almost by accident that I finally got it up and running.

I love my Tivo BOLT	I love my Tivo BOLT. However the Plex app needs quite a bit of work. It can only stream at a max of 1080p at 8mbps. All other Plex apps/devices in my home have no issue streaming at the media's original resolution and bit rate.  This issue seems to also present in the Tivo minis that I have.  Lastly, it would be great if the search feature also pinged my Plex content for results.

Love the Bolt for OTA and cord cutting	I love the Bolt. Using it with OTA and the integration of recorded and streamed shows in on interface makes it extremely easy to use for the entire family. The Tivo Android app is extremely well done as well making it easy to search and schedule recordings and stream or download recorded content.Would give it 5 starts if there were a few additional features / UI improvements that I'd like to see.

Cutting the Cord with TiVo Bolt	After 10 years with DirecTV we decided to "cut the cord." After some research, we elected to go with TiVo for over the air television and Internet streaming. I was very disappointed when Bolt did not support Hulu but TiVo Mini did. TiVo did finally roll-out their Hulu app for Bolt about ten days after we purchased the Bolt.Thus far, I have four complaints about the Bolt: First, TiVo kept downloading stuff that I had not wanted to record, I know they say that I can train the Bolt over time to know what I like but that is nonsense. We have four users in the house that all like different things, there is no way that I can associate preferences with a viewer profile; something you can do with Netflix. I ended up with over a hundred unwanted programs being recorded that I had to delete one at a time. As a result, I shut this feature off.Second the app menus are different between the two TiVo devices that I own. I bought them on the same day and expect them to look and act the same but they do not. On my Mini, Hulu never remembers what I have been watching and I have to go to a generic screen and search for the same program every time I watch the next episode of the same show.The DVR feature of the TiVo which is supposed to be the main selling point of the unit for live TV is rath
Better Late than Never	My only regret is that I didn't do the research and invest in Bolt much earlier. Beautiful interface and miles ahead of cable box technology.

Fire your cable company	Was a little rocky to start with app issues.  Trouble activating etc.  tech support is pretty weak. But once I got everything working, it is awesome!! Love the commercial skip, jump 30 seconds forward, 15 back.  Integrates well with Netflix, and Amazon. Wish it had Hulu.

Many Features Improve Viewing Experience	I haven't explored all of the Bolt's features yet. On the other hand, I'm thoroughly enjoying my exploration. For starters, programming is delivered at 1080p vs my previous 1080i from Time Warner. I'm also a YouTube fan and the ability to view my favorite channels on the big screen is great. Just started with recording shows so can't report on that yet but the process is very simple.

Really like the new Bolt	Really like the new Bolt. Works great with MoCA and Tivo minis. Sadly this is as good as it will ever be based on my 20 years of owning TiVos and never obtaining any substantive firmware updates (providing new features). My only major gripe.

Very good but could be great	Things a like about new Bolt:1. 4K compatible2. Fast processor3. Integrated Netflix appThings I do not like:1. The curved shape is odd, I would prefer a flat box.2. The new menu uses white highlight bars that a bit harsh on the eyes.3. Provide user selectible color options. I prefer the yellow highlight bars used on the previous model.
Big upgrade for my Tivo	Love the skip mode feature.Missing the Kids Zone.The UI is very clean and easy to navigate.Fast response to commandsI like the RF remote too.

Keep getting better	I love being able to skip commercials.  Love being able to record 4 shows.  Much faster connecting to Netflix than my premier.  Still adjusting to new remote.  Does seem a little buggy at times.

The good points - works great with my OTA service	The good points - works great with my OTA service, i like the recording features and the guide - well worth the price. IT does make a bit of noise when everything is quiet, but you can't hear it when the sound is turned up. I think ti was a good option for me when i cut the tie to satellite.

TiVo Bolt: cutting the cord the right way	Have truly loved the experience of TiVo. It's made my cord cutting easy by combining my OTA antenna and my VOD services. One thing that would make this an easy 5 star would be adding Sling TV. Other than that, Netflix, Amazon Video, Hulu and YouTube have filled any void of cable tv. Thanks TiVo!

Needs more streaming app support	Very impressive list of features already. Integration with HBO Go, showtime, etc. and sling TV would make this thing perfect. Hopefully support for many more streaming apps is part of future plans. Would be very easy to integrate streaming apps if it ran Android TV with access to play store.

Bolt is a good product	I like being able to record 4 shows at once and then view them on my TV or iPad.  It took awhile to debug the setup with my home network, but it's working now.  I gave it only 4 stars because I wish it didn't take so long to resets blush  the connection each  time I use the iPad.

Still working out the bugs	So far, we are happy with the Bolt overall. However, it has recorded programs short on several occasions, which left us without seeing the last few minutes of the show. We are hopeful this will resolve.  I would add that we continue to recommend the TIVO system to friends & family.

The GREAT BOLT but the sky is cloudy for streaming services...	I do LOVE The new BOLT!  As I have loved all other TIVOs in the past.  But it does fall short in the streaming service side.  I't like to at least see the other (HBO is supported) major movie channels supported like Showtime, Epic, Starz & Max.  Not to mention any of the other smaller, or local ones!  So as I love the BOLT still does not YET completely replace the ROKU or FireTV unit on the same TV.  It does do Netflix, Amazon and Hulu.  Also the included version of Plex does not handle the streams as well as my other devices, audio seems to get out of sync more often on it. TiVo Bolt	Like the bolt a lot just wish it had 2 more tuners, have  lots of tv's then I would've give  it 5 stars. Like the ease of use and how easy is to set up the mini with it too!, also the tech dept simply the best. LIVE!!!! Agent right away and very knowledgable.

Buyer beware	Very important that you read the description of this device very carefully. The advertisements would lead you to believe that you can truly watch shows from your TiVo bolt anywhere in the world. This is mostly untrue. You cannot stream video outside of your home network.  In addition, although I was not able to find this anywhere in the product description or on the TiVo website, you cannot download any show that is not broadcast on a basic network. In other words, if you want to download something from ABC, CBS, NBC, FOX  then you are in good shape. However, if you wish to download a show from any other station you probably will not be allowed to.  I have tried shows on TBS, TCM, FX, AMC, IFC, etc. and each time receive a notice that my device does not allow download of premium content.  Even Tivo support has not been willing to admit to this restriction. They keep telling me to reset my device but at the end of the day, this unit does not allow downloading except from a very few stations. Having said all of this, if you are OK with these limitations this is a terrific DVR.  It is lightning fast and actually makes Netflix and Amazon video usable.

If I cancel my account I lose the rest of the year, nicely done TiVo!

Great device that has been a serious longterm headache to get properly working, solution was completely illogical!	I've been a Tivo user for almost ten years, and my previous unit lasted forever with no problems, but was about to become obsolete with Comcast/Xfinity. So I upgraded to a Bolt because the price was reasonable, considering that a year of service was included. The interface of the Bolt is awesome and I was really enjoying my new machine, until after about a month or so when certain HD channels slowly started becoming more and more pixelated.The problem has continued to get worse, and I've been troubleshooting the problem with the advice of Tivo's website, forums online, and calls to both Xfinity and Tivo, to no avail. The issue according to Tivo is that my cable signal strength isn't good enough, but Xfinity sent a tech out and the signal is fine until it gets inside the Tivo unit, at which point readings are 65-70% signal strength (80-99% is ideal), with an SNR of 26 to 27db (29 to 35 is needed). What both Tivo and Xfinity suggested was removing any splitters in my line, but for some bizarre reason, removing a splitter results in NO SIGNAL AT ALL which is completely illogical.Tivo's tech support is frustrating and they ask you the same 40 questions without really listening to you

Love it but had to RETURN it.	I have been a TIVO fan for a very long .  My old series 3 Tivo finally died and I ran out and bought the Bolt.  I don't know if I got a bad one or the design is weak but I had to return it.  About 1/3 of my cable channels were pixilated or not even present.  The ones that were good were very, very good but the ones that were bad were horrible.  My Bolt appeared to be very sensitive to signal level and/or SNR.  I tried several combinations of amplifiers and attenuators and could make some channels come and go but could never get all channels to work at the same time.  This was very disappointing because the picture on the good channels was the best I have seen.  I replaced the power supply in my old series 3 and it is now back in service and gets all channels perfectly.  I also have a cable company box which gets all channels perfectly from the same cable spigot.  So even if the input SNR from the cable company is flakey the other two boxes work perfectly and the Bolt is far too sensitive.  I was surprised by how good the tech support from both Tivo and my cable company, TWC, was during this adventure but sadly they were unable to help. It's only available on select shows and times each day, and even then there's sometimes a delay after the show finishes before the skip updates are added to the recordings.The new Bolt box shape and color is unattractive and also makes it difficult to stack with other entertainment center equipment because nothing can sit on top of it any more. I also really miss the lights on the front that showed not just when at least one show was recording but how many shows, as the Roamio did. There's now just one recording light with the Bolt. The Bolt does not work with the Cox cable card	The Bolt does not work with the Cox cable card. I wasted a lot of time with Cox & Tivo support before they admitted it is an outstanding issue with no ETA on a fix.Tivo BOLT firmware issue with Cox CableTivo forumhttps://forums.tivo.com/pe/action/forums/displaypost?postID=11275651#e11275651Certain CableCARDs from Cox will allow Guided Setup, but after being activated and paired to the TiVo box will fail at the next step, while it is downloading what's called the channel map.  This is the data that allows the card to correctly associate the digital broadcast streams with the channel numbers, which lets the program guide data from the TiVo box record the right channels.  The known issue is that with some CableCARDs it fails at a very specific percentage number.However, not all CableCARDs are affected and many Cox users are able to set up their TiVo boxes just fine.  We would encourage you to either reschedule them or to see if you can pick up a CableCARD from their local office to try the setup again.  If it does have a problem, we can eit

Waste of money	Not very happy with this gizmo.  Sending it back.  First of all they do not tell you the mini is not wireless, so you have to run an ethernet cable from the router to the mini.  Extreme buffering on the mini, then unit cuts off and says Lost Connection.  You have to have the "perfect environment" for it to sync.  Another alternative is their Moca system which is another cost.  Not happy.

A few questions followed by a suggestion to call Verizon for activation (though the phone number was wrong). After a litany of lunacy, Verizon activated my Cablecard, though that didn't mean I got any television. After that came the connection wizard -- which took the better part of an hour to run; I left at this point.I was then informed that I'd need to activate a TiVO account. That seemed reasonable, so I went online, created an account, and paired the Bolt. And then I waited, and waited, and waited, and rebooted,

Don't waste your time.	The Bolt is a waste of money. TiVo doesn't like the cable companies and the cable companies don't like TiVo so they don't share information well. Which, causes issues. I couldn't get the channel lineup to load. It kept freezing at 72%. The cable company said it's a TiVo issue and TiVo told me to get a new cable card. After changing my cable card numerous times, eventually you begin to wonder if it's not the cable cards and something else. It's a pretty popular subject in online reviews so it's a pretty common problem. Well...I had enough sitting on hold for the cable company and then sitting on hold for TiVo. I went crawling back to my cable company for the regular DVR and they had it working within 15 minutes. Not worth the hassle.

TiVo released this box just to compete with other 4K products in the market. Their support team still do not have documents to support it. When they talk to you their menu systems are still from older TiVo models.what they see on their guides is different then what you see on the TiVo screen. VOD with xfinity does not work. TiVo or Comcast have no idea what the issue is. Finger pointing is at its exteme. Most of the time TiVo support put you on hold and never come back or they connect you to Comcast support in a conference call and then disappear from the call. Terrible support for otherwise a nice piece of hardware

Not ready for prime time.	The Bolt is riddled with software bugs.  I purchased one locally in case I had to return it.  I am glad I did.  The new and heavily marketed Skipmode is a joke.  It only works if the channel the program is recorded from is supported by TiVo and the list of channels is quite limited.  The apps seldom work right.  They constantly crash.  Plex is a big crasher.  The new Hulu app that was announced on Dec. 15 will not download and install.  I would give TiVo six months or so to get some of the bugs out so you don't end up feeling like you got ripped off.

Can't Cancel Service	Never give TiVo a credit card number, they make it impossible to cancel service. They are banking on you not noticing the charge, and when you do notice, not letting you cancel if it's not the exact date the contract ends, charging early termination fees, and sending your bill to collections. They have turned from what used to be a great, fun company into a Comcast style evil bag.The BOLT itself is horrible. It does not serve 4k signal to my 4k TV- and barely has enough storage to really hold much 4k video. The included applications (Netflix, Amazon) crash to a pink screen of death after about 3 seconds of video.  It runs as slow as the rest of the TiVos. I would give it a zero.Edit: software updates have helped many of the apps stop crashing, but it is not a great platform
Not Perfected.	We loved it. It recorded well. After two weeks, it stopped working. Following all of their repair solutions. I had enough and returned it.

I wanted to cut the cord. This isn't the way to go.	My son woke me up one morning last week to tell me the TV was broke a day after I installed the Bolt. No picture, just a black screen. Unplugged Bolt, plugged it back in and everything worked fine. For a day... It did this every morning. I couldn't stand it anymore and called TiVo support. They offered to send me a REFURBISHED unit! My Bolt was 2 weeks old!  $300 for a used poduct that needs to be unplugged and plugged in when someone wants to watch TV? No thanks! Sent it back and will stay with DirecTV. Never had an issue with the Genie and the box was free. For the same service price as the Bolt I can get a 5 tuner Genie with 4 times the recording capacity, a Roku, an Apple TV, Chromecast AND a Fire TV. Why spend $15 a month for a box that didn't work from day one.
BIG waste of time & $$	Total kraP.  COX couldn't get to work after 3 months and 6 visits.  BIG waste of time & $$.

Customer Service Issues Can Delay Set Up by Days or Weeks	Please be prepared to be disappointed by the customer service. I purchased this device and apparently set up instructions are so off you will need to browse blogs and TiVo community threads to figure out how to resolve issues. I'm 12 hours into attempting to set up my device and have been unable to get a Media Access Key. My device says its temporarily unavailable. I get directions to log into my TiVo account to get it, but apparently you can't set up a TiVo account (to log into) without having the media access key first. Apparently its a common problem because there are tons of blogs dedicated to this.  Some people have been talking to customer service for weeks about this. Customer Service doesn't open until 11am (in my timezone) which means I had to wait over 14 hours to resolve an issue that is common.

Caution, this review was written by a trusting fool who should have known better.	The commercial-skip function applies to only 20 prime-time shows. A committee made up of a handful of TiVo employees watches the first run of these shows, it times the beginning and duration of each commercial, then it sends this low-tech information to all the Bolt boxes, maybe. "Skip" shows are said to be marked with a special symbol for easy identification.They are not. After about 72 hours, I have been unable even to detect a single commercial-skipping show, much less actually skip commercials. The old, annoying, hit-or-miss skip methods work, but not any better than on pre-Bolt machines.The shows selected are chosen solely on the basis of popularity. If you have more taste than a prime-time TV lover (i.e any taste in entertainment at all) you're outa luck. If not, this may be the appliance of your dreams.As a corporation, TiVo's not all bad. TiVo intentionally uses software to make their products unusable after a few years.	I received a TiVo Bolt as a gift.  I had to return it. While I have long been a fan of the TiVo interfaces (I even bought one for my parents).  But I must warn prospective buyers of how TiVo will, down the road, intentionally make your box not function.When I called to activate this box, I also wanted to reactivate an old box.  TiVo gives you a discount on the monthly fees for multiple boxes.  I had bough my last TiVo in 2009 and deactivated it in 2014.  When I deactivated my box in 2014, they told me I could reactivate at any time.  But when I called today, they told me that my old box will no longer ever be able to be activated and that I should consider upgrading to a new box.  Put another way, they tell you that the $300 device you bought 6 years ago is now worthless. But had I never cancelled my service, it would still be working.  This is not a joke.I had no choice but to return my TiVo Bolt as I have no desire to conduct business with a company that operates in this way.  Beware.

Now I officially hate a company I was a fan of for years ...	After 10 years of TiVo I called to cancel because we moved. I am informed that due to recent policy changes once I cancel I cannot sell or gift my TiVo box making the device worthless. Now I officially hate a company I was a fan of for years so kudos TiVo. Not just the money but now this huge piece of electronics is trash and has to be recycled or end up in landfill. So TiVo is now my enemy. Congrats

TIVO great product, Horrible customer care! Avoid buying.	TIVO shows no regard for loyal customers. TIVO simply wants to gouge as my money out of customers as possible. I purchased a TIVO when the company was new, and also purchased lifetime service plan. The catch I learned later is, the service works with one box, no matter how out-of-date the box becomes. TIVO should allow lifetime subscribers like myself to transfer the service to a newer box. If that was the case, I would have purchased at least 2 newer units by now.  My interest was really peaked when the Bolt was released. It does everything I needed from a OTA DVR.  However, instead of buying the new TIVO box, I purchased a 4-Tuner TABLO and their lifetime service, which transfers to all new boxes. TIVO why not think about long time customers sometimes?  When I first purchased my TIVO I strongly recommended it to family and friends. Now, I strongly recommend against it. TIVO adjust your profit profile regarding current customer's. You can make money from the units as well as the service.

Would give customer support negative stars if possible	This review is about Tivo customer support. I bought a gen 2 Tivo in December 2009 direct from the company and an extra remote and wifi adapter from Amazon. After a years worth of seeing how it worked, I went for the lifetime subscription. In Oct 2015 (less than 5 years from my box purchase) I find out that Tivo has removed the ability to program my dvr online because it is too old - less than 5 years! When I went to their so-called customer support chat, this was the response from them (taken direct from the chat)"(10/14/2015, 4:26:04 PM): TiVo has moved into the future and needed to remove features from the older boxes in order to move forward. We invite you to move forward with us. "Remove features???????????? In other words, my lifetime subscription that was based on all the features available at the time is no longer useful. Less than 5 years they remove features. Remember that if you buy a Tivo. Don't count on any features remaining and don't ever buy a lifetime subscription. This has to be one of the worst customer support
